content.description:
Start on two sidepulls in the middle of the boulder. They are the crimps for the crux of

Creeping in the Dark Traverse

. Top out up and right.

This is a fun traverse with a memorable stemming sequence - awesome and overlooked.

"Start on the far right and traverse left, staying low, about 40 feet to finish [up the rail]"

You could make this harder with some contrived stay very low variations. V6 grade based on flagstaff guide YMMV.
SDS matched on an incut horizontal. Move up and right to an obvious rail, and follow it to the top.
content.location:
The start hold is shared with '

Creeping Death

' and is found down and left from the obvious rail.

content.description: SDS matched on an incut horizontal. Move left to a fragile sidepull, then continue up and left to a licheny, pebble finish.
content.location:
The start hold is down and left of the obvious big rail on the left side of the block. Both '

Creeping in the Dark

' and 'Creeping Death' use the same start hold.

content.description:
Start matched on the same small incut jug on the left side of the face that

Creeping Death

and

Creeping in the Dark

use.

Move up the rail of

Creeping in the Dark

until you can reach down to the two small, left-facing sidepulls of the

Creeping in the Dark Traverse

.

Continue rightwards, staying

low

and avoiding the midway rest jug and any of the holds on the bulge that overhangs the right end of the traverse.

This part might be a little scrunchy for those afflicted by excess height.

Finish by matching on a fairly obvious knob at the right corner.
content.location: Sit down start on an incut jug (big enough for 1 and 1/3 hands) on the left end of the face.
